title: bit4uYT
author: bit4uYT
content: Imagine if there was a thing, what thing? I don't know, just imagine a thing that people could store value, just like gold, and at the same time they could exchange this thing among everyone on earth without depending of any trusted partier. This thing is also limited just like gold, and it is so limited that there is only 21 millions available, but it is not a problem because you can buy literally only $1 dollar of it in seconds. There is no way you can just print more of this thing because there are thousands of copies of every single transactions all around the world. And there are also thousands and thousands of people that are building around this thing, discovering new technologies, searching for possible fails and improving it, writing about it, teaching about it, well..Bitcoin is the thing.Any ideas to spread the Bitcoin education to the world?I'm making a YouTube channel to simplify Bitcoin for beginners, and also making daily threads on Twitter.Check my new thread - "Bitcoin simplified for beginners" and give me feedback:https://twitter.com/bit4uYT/status/1652713706738921472

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Went through  the thread and I can say that OP you tried I must give you that and i believe that the newbies would have a starting knowledge about what Bitcoin is all about.But I noticed something rather than teaching bitcoin you were selling the idea BITCOIN to new people, I understand that you stand as a bitcoin enthusiast, but their are dangers teaching newbies about bitcoin without drawing their attention to the dangers.The dangers this can lead to is newbies aren’t aware of the dangers and the get euphoric about any bitcoin and can lead to them.# Joining scam social media account (Facebook, twitter, YouTube)# Ponzi schemes# can get trapped with scammers and many moreTelling newbies about the dangers of Bitcoin should not be secondary it should be amongst the primary things you tell them about.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: It is a great idea to teach bitcoin to people but that depends on how in-depth your own knowledge is. This is not to undermine you mate, but this is your first post on the forum and you’re going straight to looking for a way to create awareness for it. The first thing should be you seeking knowledge yourself and understanding it before educating others. This could be done by engaging in bitcoin yourself as we say experience is the best teacher.You can check out the links below for the basic knowledge in bitcoin. This will help you in achieving your goal. https://learnmeabitcoin.com/https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbookThe major thing education to spread about bitcoin is how to purchase and how to secure your wallet from possible attacks as this is the biggest obstacle face by learners or newbies. Investing into bitcoin although it is an hedge against inflation is risky due to its volatility so when educating yourself and others it best not to invest an amount that is beyond your limit of losing

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: I don't even know where to start — it's just not that convincing for a newbie's perspective. You said "I will start from the very beginning and I will explain like I was explaining for a child", then you mention proof of work, blockchain, and mining lol.Overall, it's not something I'd share to anyone.Don't get discouraged though — you can definitely improve it to the point that maybe it's worth sharing some time in the future when it gets good enough. After all, a great way of learning something is trying to teach that thing.Anyway, here's my handy picks for when someone wants to learn bitcoin/crypto.* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://chainsec.io* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters* https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook#chapters

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: One of the fastest ways that can help to spread Bitcoin education is by posting Bitcoin sites that lecture about Bitcoin.  Another way is by sharing information about Bitcoin learning tools and sites with our friends, relatives, and community.  We don't need to create our own social media channel to explain Bitcoin, we just need to link people who are interested in Bitcoin to the sites that explain Bitcoin.Since there are lots of sites and channels that give information about Bitcoin, what we need is linking interested people to these channels and sites.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: My suggestion is to remove the tweet links from your post. As a newcomer, it appears that you are promoting your Twitter account. It would be better if you edited your post by removing the Twitter links. Before teaching others about Bitcoin, it's crucial to learn about it properly yourself. There are different stages of learning, and it's essential to start from the basics and progress to advanced topics. Instead of considering Bitcoin solely as an investment, explain how it works in detail. By doing so, newbies will learn the proper way to navigate the topic.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Already bitccoin has made itself relevant, discussing the way forward of bitcoin in the aspect of bitcoin education, is something that the global has already I'm not troubled from bitccoin education.

comments.author: Fatunad
comments.body: Quote from: bit4uYT on April 30, 2023, 06:37:50 PMImagine if there was a thing, what thing? I don't know, just imagine a thing that people could store value, just like gold, and at the same time they could exchange this thing among everyone on earth without depending of any trusted partier. This thing is also limited just like gold, and it is so limited that there is only 21 millions available, but it is not a problem because you can buy literally only $1 dollar of it in seconds. There is no way you can just print more of this thing because there are thousands of copies of every single transactions all around the world. And there are also thousands and thousands of people that are building around this thing, discovering new technologies, searching for possible fails and improving it, writing about it, teaching about it, well..Bitcoin is the thing.Any ideas to spread the Bitcoin education to the world?I'm making a YouTube channel to simplify Bitcoin for beginners, and also making daily threads on Twitter.Check my new thread - "Bitcoin simplified for beginners" and give me feedback:https://twitter.com/bit4uYT/status/1652713706738921472Actually just let recognition or adoption move its way but it wont really be that bad if you do make out some introduction into those people who do you know or inside your family on at least been spreading up the wordin regards about its existence which it would somewhat be able to contribute in terms of recognition but of course even if we dont really be able to do such thing. Things would normally be flowing considering that we are still a decade old and there's still soo much room to grow because we arent that still been heard off totally. If ever there are people who do really make out some approach to you and asking out about Bitcoin then it is really just that right that you would really be telling them about the basics, the thing on here is that you shouldnt really be giving out some assurance that they would really be making money or profitsbecause this is where you would really be blamed out on the time that they would really be losing up money and if you dont like for it to happen then its always ideal for you to explain out about its riskand the danger when it comes to volatility.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Spreading the word about bitcoin through social media is a good thing. There could be some conflict from others who have that plan and goal before when they've become paid influencers for particular projects so their goal has changed. Like a casual influencer and wants to educate people that will follow him or no matter how many followers you've got, as long as it's your passion to educate others with what you know then you'll eventually get noticed.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: So I have a Gaming PC and I have some Bitcoin stickers on my Cabinet. Most of my friends saw it and were interested to know more about Crypto rather than Bitcoin itself. They find Bitcoin similar to every other crypto asset in the market which made me realize that someone needs to provide a clear difference between a Bitcoin and an Ethereum or a Dogecoin.At that situation, I literally had to compare Bitcoin with gold which is funny as some people consider it rival.

comments.author: MoonOfLife
comments.body: There have been many similar threads like this and I haven't seen anyone with a suggestion or a working solution. In my opinion, you don't need to find a way to educate people about bitcoin, as that is beyond your reach. The best way you should teach your loved ones about bitcoin and from there people spread the word about bitcoin. That way, bitcoin will also quickly gain popularity. Don't think the methods are too sublime when your own family does not know about bitcoin.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: It is clear that you are referring to bitcoin in this topic you made, but I also just want you to know that in my time here in this industry I have never experienced anyone who can buy bitcoin for 1$.        What I know is that there is no cryptocurrency exchange that allows traders to buy bitcoin for just 1$. Or if you know of an exchange, please indicate it here because I don't know if there really is one.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: bit4uYT on April 30, 2023, 06:37:50 PMImagine if there was a thing, what thing? I don't know, just imagine a thing that people could store value, just like gold, and at the same time they could exchange this thing among everyone on earth without depending of any trusted partier. This thing is also limited just like gold, and it is so limited that there is only 21 millions availableThe bullish case for Bitcoin. Buy it on Amazon store if you don't want to read it online on Medium.How is the 21 Million Bitcoin Cap Defined and Enforced?Controlled supplyQuotebut it is not a problem because you can buy literally only $1 dollar of it in seconds.Do you think buying $1 bitcoin is good and recommended?Even with Lightning network, I think $1 is not a good amount for Dollar Cost Averaging. Let's try to buy like $10 or $20 to DCA and increase your amount of bitcoin.https://dcabtc.com/

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Quote from: bit4uYT on April 30, 2023, 06:37:50 PMat the same time they could exchange this thing among everyone on earth without depending of any trusted partier. but it is not a problem because you can buy literally only $1 dollar of it in seconds.The understanding of you can exchange your Bitcoin without any trusted party is just only in theory, almost everyone bought their coins through centralized exchanges.Buy Bitcoin with a dollar? this is incorrect because the current fees is quite high [1] and any exchanges ask minimum deposit in order to buy Bitcoin. There's a way to buy Bitcoin with a dollar, but it's not worth it and better to find a job with higher salary.Helping a newbie to understand about Bitcoin can be started on this forum! you don't have to convince someone to buy Bitcoin, if they interested, they will find a way to buy Bitcoin and learn by themselves.[1] https://mempool.space/

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: bit4uYT on April 30, 2023, 06:37:50 PMAny ideas to spread the Bitcoin education to the world?If you really understand that bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency then you will know and see the need for an Individuals responsibility here needed, one don't have to wait for others before he can engage on doing something to help facilitate bitcoin adoption than from a personal interest, once you accept this personal challenge, then you can take bitcoin education and adoption to any length on your own without anything to deter you, most of the educational awareness medium may also be financial and time demanding, you will also needs to be very sound in knowing many things about the entire bitcoin network because questions may br thrown at you at any time, but it's a decision to take which you can never regret because you're bringing others into enlightenment in giving out bitcoin education on your own interest for their own good.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: bit4uYT on April 30, 2023, 06:37:50 PMThis thing is also limited just like gold, and it is so limited that there is only 21 millions available, but it is not a problem because you can buy literally only $1 dollar of it in seconds.In relevant quarters, so many people attribute the "limitness" of gold to scarcity and not that it's as limited as Bitcoin's 21 million total supply. No one can truly tell you when gold supply will run out and at what quantity in its supply but we can day that of Bitcoin. It's the same thing that applies to every natural resources which Bitcoin isn't. I just needed to kick that out.QuoteAny ideas to spread the Bitcoin education to the world?Now to the issue at hand. The simple way is either by talking about it to those around us or by writing about it so that many who aren't around us can get acquitted about it. Any thing other than that is superfluous and may irritate those who don't give a damn about Bitcoin.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I'm not sure that it's simple to buy $1 worth of Bitcoin 'in seconds', to be honest, considering transaction fees, minimum amounts on centralized exchanges and transaction processing time. But other than that, it seems fairly accurate. I'd also add here that, unlike gold, it can't come in different qualities or turn out to be fake. And unlike gold, it doesn't weigh anything, so you can access it anywhere and don't have to be physically close to someone else to transfer it. Also, while gold is limited in total supply, we don't really know how much gold is out there even on Earth, let alone in space, which can become a big devaluation risk in the future.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: The best way to promote Bitcoin and educate people about it is by conducting free seminars in different locations. The seminars should be conducted by well educated crypto enthusiasts because people really don't care about those who aren't well educated about Bitcoin themselves and are trying to promote it with low levels of awareness and following. The seminars will attract so many investors into this technology and they will add Bitcoin into their list of investments.Another very good way to promote Bitcoin is though social media. Many good social media celebrities mostly on YouTube who can promote it through their live streams because thousands of people attend those live streams. They can easily recommend Bitcoin to their followers and offer them giveaways in Bitcoin and that will create excitement and  passion in the minds of the viewers. They will try their best to learn about this technology and gradually incorporate it in their day to day life.

comments.author: glendall
comments.body: Quote from: bettercrypto on May 01, 2023, 02:03:30 AMIt is clear that you are referring to bitcoin in this topic you made, but I also just want you to know that in my time here in this industry I have never experienced anyone who can buy bitcoin for 1$.        What I know is that there is no cryptocurrency exchange that allows traders to buy bitcoin for just 1$. Or if you know of an exchange, please indicate it here because I don't know if there really is one.I was also curious where I could buy 1$ btc. Of the many exchanges I visited, they could buy at least 10$ in my fiat currency. I am also very surprised where I can buy BTC for 1$, even in the retail class, it will be a loss if I only buy 1$

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Educating people about Bitcoin is not something you can do alone, you can oy do your part, and you don't need to confuse people because not everyone is ready to go into Bitcoin, it takes time so do not force or confuse anyone to invest in Bitcoin.Don't take this as something you must only do, because Bitcoin has done a lot for itself if it has made it this far. Many others are doing the same thing, but they are merely spreading the word about Bitcoin, and they will decide for themselves whether or not to do research or invest. Let them see a good reason to pursue this Bitcoin journey first.Before I can talk about Bitcoin to anyone, I must see your interest in making money online, or maybe if you are in the line of making money from side hustle online, I believe that these type of people will listen to me, they can easily do research on their own and know more about Bitcoin.
